Description: Mummy of a boy, with gilded rectangles on the face. Skull - There is a linear crack/fracture extending horizontally across the occipital bone. Thorax and Abdomen - The lateral view shows an opacity that could represent the shrunken remains of viscera or heart. All bones including the pelvis and hips appear normal. Many of the dorsal and lumbar intervertebral discs are partially opaque. Arms - Extended. Hands with extended fingers, their palmar surfaces in contact with the outer aspect of the thighs. Legs - All bones and joints appear normal.
Curator's comments: Discussed: Leslie and Levell, International Journal of Dermatology 45 (2006), 619-620. Davey et al, Yearbook of Mummy Studies 2 (2014), 81-6.
Bibliographic references: Dawson & Gray 1968 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antqiuities in the British Museum: Mummies and Human Remains (73)
Fletcher, Antoine and Hill 2014 / Regarding the Dead: Human Remains in the British Museum (p.106, p.111, table 1)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
